node.title: Dozens killed in one of Russia's worst coal mine disasters since Soviet era
node.description: An accident in a Siberian coal mine kills more than 50 people, including six rescuers, in one of Russia's worst mining disasters since Soviet times.

node.title: Concerns raised about KiwiRail's planned 177ha Palmerston North yard expansion
node.description: KiwiRail has outgrown its decades-old rail yard in Palmerston North and plans to transform 177 hectares of land to the north of the city into a 24-7 operation designed to accommodate trains up to 1.5…

node.title: Rain pummels east coast, swelling rivers, wiping out crops
node.description: Hopes of a bumper harvest are dashed in parts of New South Wales as rain continues, flooding towns and leaving farmers feeling anxious.

node.title: New COVID-19 variant described as 'worst one yet' emerges in South Africa
node.description: Britain bans travellers from six countries as scientists identify a new coronavirus variant they say has mutations likely make it more infectious and resistant to vaccines.

node.title: Tim Paine takes leave of absence 'for the foreseeable future'
node.description: The former test captain has decided to take a break from all forms of cricket and will not be available for the upcoming Ashes, following discussions over the past day with Cricket Tasmania.

node.title: 2degrees and Orcon Group merger talks may have hit a wall - media report
node.description: Merger talks between telecommunications company 2degrees and local broadband operator Orcon Group may have hit a wall, according to an Australian media report.

node.title: Portugal reimposes Covid-19 restrictions as cases rise
node.description: Portugal, where about 87 percent of the population is fully inoculated against Covid-19, announced it would reimpose some restrictions to stop a surge in cases.

node.title: Covid-19: Rapid antigen tests 'not going to pick everyone up' - researcher
node.description: Rapid antigen tests can miss up to 44 percent of positive Covid-19 cases, according to a new study out in the New Zealand Medical Journal. Audio

node.title: Expert says chronic fatigue sufferers should be exempt from Covid-19 vaccination
node.description: One of the country's leading biomedical scientists has written to the prime minister and director-general of health urging vaccination exemptions for chronic fatigue syndrome sufferers.

node.title: Police looking for dashcam footage in homicide investigation
node.description: Police are seeking dashcam footage that may help their investigation into a West Auckland homicide.

node.title: Proposed RMA change sees online bidding on houses drive prices further - auctioneer
node.description: Auckland's housing market continues to soar despite the city spending more than 100 days in lockdown whilst bidders buy houses online. Audio

node.title: Service set up to help start-up businesses
node.description: A trio of business leaders have set up an advisory service to help early-stage start-ups develop their businesses.

node.title: Solomons police overrun, Australia deploying support personnel
node.description: Police in Solomon Islands were overrun today as rioters and looters tore through the capital honiara.

node.title: More Than $90 Million Spent in New Jersey Governor's Race, State's Second Costliest
node.description: The number falls below the inflation-adjusted amount raised during the state's 2005's gubernatorial election.

node.title: Abuses Under Gambia’s Ex-Ruler Should Be Prosecuted, Inquiry Says
node.description: A commission’s long-awaited investigation reported widespread human rights violations, but it is not clear if anyone will be charged with crimes.

node.title: Turkish police fire rubber bullets at women protesting against male violence
node.description: Turkish police fire tear gas and rubber bullets at thousands of women protesting against male violence in Istanbul.

node.title: NSW Police expect William Tyrrell search time to 'double' due to wild weather
node.description: NSW Police say the search for William Tyrrell's remains on the Mid North Coast "may be extended" due to poor weather forecast to lash the east coast.

node.title: Food exporters' vaccine mandate put on ice
node.description: The introduction of a vaccine mandate for food exporters is on ice for now, with the sector instead being encouraged to use a new assessment tool that'll be released next month.

node.title: Consumers urged to not get carried away with Black Friday hype
node.description: The Commerce Commission is urging retailers to follow the law during tomorrow's Black Friday sales. Audio

node.title: Peter Jackson on how Tolkien stopped a Beatles LOTR film
node.description: 1968 was a pivotal year in Peter Jackson's life - it was then that JRR Tolkien refused The Beatles permission to make a film version of The Lord of The Rings. Decades later, the Beatles and Sir Peter…

node.title: New Zealander tenor Simon O'Neill nominated for two Grammy awards
node.description: New Zealander Simon O'Neill has snagged two Grammy nominations for Best Choral Performance and Best Engineered Album in Classical. New Zealander Simon O'Neill has snagged two Grammy nominations for…

node.title: How a Prosecutor Addressed a Mostly White Jury and Won a Conviction in the Arbery Case
node.description: Linda Dunikoski, a prosecutor brought in from the Atlanta area, struck a careful tone in a case that many saw as an obvious act of racial violence.

node.title: Bear Spray Used in Latest Smash-and-Grab Robbery at Los Angeles Mall
node.description: Los Angeles police said they are investigating the incident, which is one of several retail thefts that have occurred in California over the last two weeks.

node.title: Midnight Oil announce final tour
node.description: One of Australia's greatest bands has announced their touring days are coming to an end.

node.title: Government will not make complaint about Chinese navy ship near Australian waters
node.description: The Prime Minister says the government had been aware of a Chinese navy ship that was in waters off the Australian coast recently, adding it did not break international law.

node.title: Victoria records 1,362 new COVID-19 cases and seven deaths
node.description: There are now 10,887 active cases of COVID in the state, as the death toll for the current outbreak rises to 494.

node.title: Police fear for baby reportedly left in Sydney coffee shop with $200 cash
node.description: The Family Court and AFP have gone public about the case of a missing baby who was reportedly left in the care of a woman in a Sydney coffee shop.

node.title: Pilot to appear in court charged with murder of missing Victorian campers
node.description: A 55-year-old Melbourne pilot will appear in the Sale Magistrates Court this morning charged with the murder of Russell Hill and Carol Clay, who went missing in March 2020.

node.title: Former top NZ marathon runner criticises new IOC transgender rules
node.description: Former New Zealand marathon runner Alison Roe has criticised the International Olympic Committee's new framework for transgender and intersex athletes.

node.title: Britain will bar flights from six African countries as it investigates a new variant.
node.description: The British health secretary said the ban takes effect on Friday. Earlier on Thursday, South African scientists said they had identified a new variant.
